Name: Fulvous Whistling Duck
How_to_identify: Bright cinnamon color, long legs, distinctive whistling call. No significant male/female distinction in plumage.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Bright cinnamon with darker back and lighter belly
Diet: Seeds, aquatic plants, rice, small aquatic animals

Name: Lesser Whistling Duck
How_to_identify: Small size, long neck, chestnut body with a long yellowish bill. Males and females look alike.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Chestnut body with darker wings and back, yellowish bill
Diet: Aquatic vegetation, seeds, small fish, and snails

Name: Red-breasted Goose
Best_seen_at: Not commonly found in India, vagrant sightings
How_to_identify: Reddish-brown breast, black head, neck, and upper parts, white face patches. Males and females are similar.

Name: Bar-headed Goose
How_to_identify: Two distinctive black bars on the back of the head, white neck, and light grey body. Both sexes are alike.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: White, grey, with two distinctive black bars on the head
Diet: Barley, wheat, rice, and other grains; also aquatic vegetation

Name: Greylag Goose
How_to_identify: Large grey goose, orange beak, pink legs. Males are generally larger than females.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Grey with lighter belly, orange beak
Diet: Grasses, roots, grains, and aquatic plants

Name: Taiga Bean Goose
How_to_identify: Brown body, orange legs, and bill. Long neck. Males and females are similar.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Brown with orange legs and bill

Name: Tundra Bean Goose
How_to_identify: Similar to Taiga Bean Goose but with shorter neck and bill. Brown body, orange legs, and bill.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Brown with orange legs and bill

Name: Greater White-fronted Goose
How_to_identify: White patch at the base of the beak, brown body with black bars. Both sexes similar.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Brown with white front, black barring on belly

Name: Lesser White-fronted Goose
How_to_identify: Similar to Greater but smaller with a more pronounced white face patch and yellow legs.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Brown body, white front, black barring on belly, yellow legs
Diet: Grasses, berries, grains, and aquatic plants

Name: Mute Swan
How_to_identify: All white with an orange bill and a distinctive knob at the base. Males (cobs) larger than females (pens).
Diet: Aquatic vegetation, small fish, and insects
